resources.string: This application is for education\nand understanding purposes only.\nYou should summon expert help interpreting Arterial Blood Gas Results.
The Alveolar - Arterial gradient is normal\n\n
The Alveolar - Arterial gradient is high\n\n

The Alveolar - Arterial gradient is very high.
There is a problem getting Oxygen through the alveolae into the blood of the lungs

pH Values of 7.10 and below need 
swift correction
summon expert help quickly
respiratory acidosis - mild - a little too much CO2 in blood making it acidic\n\n
respiratory acidosis - moderate - too much CO2 in blood making it acidic\n\n
respiratory acidosis - SEVERE - far too much CO2 in blood making it acidic\n\n
respiratory alkalosis - mild - most likely to be compensation for metabolic acidosis or manual over ventilation\n\n
respiratory alkalosis - moderate- most likely to be compensation for metabolic acidosis or manual over ventilation\n\n
respiratory alkalosis - SEVERE - most likely to be compensation for metabolic acidosis or manual over ventilation\n\n
Metabolic acidosis - mild - probably due to ketoacidosis or lactic acidosis\n\n
Metabolic acidosis - moderate probably due to ketoacidosis or lactic acidosis\n\n
Metabolic acidosis - severe probably due to ketoacidosis or lactic acidosis\n\n
Metabolic alkalosis - mild - often due to compensation for high PaCO2 such as in COPD and Asthma\n\n
Metabolic alkalosis - moderate - often due to compensation for high PaCO2 such as in COPD and Asthma\n\n
Metabolic alkalosis - severe - often due to compensation for high PaCO2 such as in COPD and Asthma\n\n
Respiratory alkalosis with renal compensation pH may be in normal range if renal compensation is virtually complete\n\n

Metabolic alkalosis with
respiratory compensation pH may be in normal range if respiratory compensation is virtually complete
Respiratory acidosis with renal compensation pH may be in normal range if renal compensation is virtually complete\n\n
Metabolic acidosis with respiratory compensation pH may be in normal range if respiratory compensation is virtually complete\n\n
